title: Cruelty to animals by fighting dogs in the
context: [§711-1109.35] Cruelty to animals by fighting dogs in the second degree. (1) A person commits the offense of cruelty to animals by fighting dogs in the second degree if the person knowingly: (a) Wagers on a dogfight; (b) Attends or pays to attend a dogfight; or &copy; Possesses any device intended to enhance the dog&rsquo;s fighting ability with the intent that the device be used to train or prepare the dog for a dogfight. (2) As used in this section: &ldquo;Bait dog&rdquo; means a live animal used to train or prepare dogs for a dogfight. &ldquo;Device&rdquo; means both animate and inanimate objects and includes live animals used as bait dogs. &ldquo;Dogfight&rdquo; means a dog or dogs pitted against another dog or dogs with the intent that the encounter will result in injury to one or more of the dogs. &ldquo;Wager&rdquo; means staking or risking something of value on the outcome of a dogfight. (3) Cruelty to animals by fighting dogs in the second degree is a class C felony. [L 2011, c 149, §1]
